Submodules¶

syft.core.utils module¶

Framework agnostic static utility functions.

class syft.core.utils.PythonEncoder(retrieve_tensorvar: bool = False) → None[source]¶

Bases: object

Encode python and torch objects to be JSON-able In particular, (hooked) Torch objects are replaced by their id. Note that a python object is returned, not JSON.

Performs encoding, and retrieves if requested all the tensors and Variables found

class syft.core.utils.PythonJSONDecoder(worker, *args, **kwargs) → None[source]¶

Bases: json.decoder.JSONDecoder

Decode JSON and reinsert python types when needed Retrieve Torch objects replaced by their id

__init__(worker, *args, **kwargs) → None[source]¶
__module__ = 'syft.core.utils'¶
custom_obj_hook(dct: typing.Union[typing.Dict[str, typing.Union[int, typing.Any]], slice]) → typing.Union[typing.Dict[str, typing.Union[int, typing.Any]], slice][source]¶

Is called on every dict found. We check if some keys correspond to special keywords referring to a type we need to re-cast (e.g. tuple, or torch Variable). Note that in the case we have such a keyword, we will have created at encoding a dict with a single key value pair, so the return if the for loop is valid.

syft.core.utils.is_in_place_method(attr: str) → bool[source]¶

Determines if the method is in-place (ie modifies the self) TODO: Can you do better?
